poem:
### The Silence of Airwaves

In the noise of bright screens,  
a voice cut—how swift  
the severance of thought  
from consequence. Words,  
untethered, become wings  
of iron, heavy with  
the ballast of belief.  
Who bears the burden  
in the end? Even silence  
speaks, an echo shaping  
the absent air.
